case_title: SHAH FAISAL and another vs STATE
reference_no_or_id: Crl. Appeal No, 297 of 2005 & Crl. Appeal No, 318 of 2005
complaint_summary: The appellants challenged the admissibility of the Chemical Examiner's report from the Forensic Science Laboratory Balochistan under the Control of Narcotic Substances Act, 1997.
investigation_summary: The investigation involved the submission of reports by the Forensic Science Laboratory Balochistan, which were contested for their admissibility under Sections 34, 35, and 36 of the Control of Narcotic Substances Act, 1997.
judgment_summary: The court ruled that the Forensic Science Laboratory Balochistan, as a Provincial Narcotics Testing Laboratory, was validly notified as a Federal Narcotics Testing Laboratory under Section 34 of the Control of Narcotic Substances Act, 1997. Reports from Chemical Examiners were deemed admissible under Sections 34 and 35 of the Act.
Decision_or_verdict: Order accordingly; appeals to be fixed before Division Bench for regular hearing.
legal_arguments: Appellants argued that no Federal Narcotics Testing Laboratory was established or notified, making the reports inadmissible under Sections 34, 35, and 36 of the Control of Narcotic Substances Act, 1997.
Prosecution argued that Provincial Testing Laboratories were declared Federal Narcotics Testing Laboratories under SRO No. 596(1)/97, making their reports admissible.
appeal_number: Crl. Appeal No, 297 of 2005 & Crl. Appeal No, 318 of 2005
key_issues: Admissibility of Chemical Examiner's report under Control of Narcotic Substances Act, 1997
Notification of Provincial Laboratories as Federal Narcotics Testing Laboratories

maxims.Repeal by implication: Later enactments worded in affirmative terms do not repeal earlier laws unless expressly stated.

legal_terms.Federal Narcotics Testing Laboratory: A laboratory notified by the Federal Government under Section 34 of the Control of Narcotic Substances Act, 1997.
legal_terms.Government Analyst: An expert notified under Section 35 of the Control of Narcotic Substances Act, 1997.

words_and_phrases.Admissible Evidence: Evidence that is allowed to be presented in court under statutory provisions.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the admissibility of reports from the Forensic Science Laboratory Balochistan under the Control of Narcotic Substances Act, 1997. The court upheld the validity of these reports, citing proper notification under Section 34 and compliance with Sections 35 and 510 Cr.P.C.
